defs: the shape of a round plane figure whose circumference is everywhere equidistant from its centre; a circular form.
wearing, adorned with, an ear-ring or ear-rings.
having the form of a circle; circular.
an astrological diagram, depicting the positions of planets at the time of one's birth.
a coiled serpent.
the plant Mollugo cerviana of Aizoaceae family.
the tree Clerodendrum (Clerodendron) inerme of Verbenaceae family; littoral glory tree.
a herb, once believed to convert tin into silver.
any of various families of winged hymenopteran insects, characterised by a slender body with the abdomen attached by a narrow stalk, biting mouthparts; a wasp.
a peafowl, the brilliant plumage and a tail (with eyelike markings) of the male of which can be expanded erect in display like a fan; a peacock or peahen.
Śiva.
Varuṇa, the Sea-God.
a spotted-deer.
= ಕುಂಡಲಿನಿ.
being in the form of a coil; wound about a centre in an enlarging or decreasing continuous circular motion, either on a flat plane or rising in a cone; coiled.
wearing, adorned with, an ear-ring.

(myst.) the cosmic power latent at the base of the physical system of human beings, in the form of microcosm which, when awakened by yogic methods, proceeds upward through different planes of consciousness, rendering each of them dynamic and make the individual possess, and be possessed by, the universal consciousness.
= ಕುಂಡಲಿನಿ.
(myst.) the yogic process of activating the spiritual potency of human being in order to have union with the universal spirit.
= ಕುಂಡಲಿನಿ.
the act of turning something into a coil; a forming of a circle.
(myth.) Ādiśeṣa, the king of serpents.
Viṣṇu, whose couch is a serpent.
= ಕುಂಡಲೀಶ.
= ಕುಂಡಲ.
a particular kind of sacrifice.
= ಕುಂಡಲ.
= ಕುಂಡಲಿತ.
a small water-carrier made of coconut-shell.
Śiva, the holder of Gangā, the celestial river, on his head.
the leaf like spathe over the flowers of the plantain.
a spathe of the plantain inflorescence.
a snake or scorpion bite.
the plant Memecylon malabaricum of Melastomataceae family.
either of the two fleshy, rounded parts at the back of the hips; either half of the rump; the buttock.
the bottom of a vessel.

ಕುಂಡೆಯ ಕುೞಿ kuṇḍeya kuḷi the opening at the lower end of the alimentary canal; the anus; ಕುಂಡೆಯೂರು kuṇḍeyaūru to sit on; ಕುಂಡೆ ಬೆಳೆದರೆ ಗೌಡನಾದಾನೆ? kuṇḍe beḷedare gauḍanādāne? (prov.) mere aging or development of muscles does not bring wisdom; it is not the beard that makes the philosopher.
the plant Linociera ramiflora (= L. intermedia) of Oleaceae family; common hill olive.
a small, passerine bird of Motacillidae family, with long wing feathers and a very long tail that wags up and down; a wag tail.
a small under-garment just to cover the loins.
any of a family (Sciuridae) of small rodents living in trees, on the ground or in burrows and usu. having a long bushy tail; a squirrel.
a man who has pederasty with another man; a homo-sexual male; a catamite.
a demon-deity.
a weapon consisting of a long, heavy shaft with a sharp point, usu. of metal for thrusting or throwing; a kind of spear.
a soldier who fights with a heavy spear (as in a war).

a man who is the pride of the Kuntaṇa (Kuntala), the northern part of the present Karnāṭaka.
the hair growing on the head.

(mus.) a mode, in Karnāṭaka system, derived from the main mode Kāntāmaṇi.
a type of thin, whitish, hair like cloud, found at high altitudes and consisting of ice crystals which often produces halo phenomena; cirrus cloud; cirrostratus.

the queen mother of Pāṇḍavas, in the Epic Mahābhārata.

any of several soft-furred, large-eared, rodentlike burrowing mammals of the family Leporidae, (order Lagomorpha) having a divided upper lip and long hind legs; a rabbit.

all that contingent in an army that comes under the control of a captain.
